facts: Tet greeting songs are performed during Lunar New Year visits
Highland minority groups have distinct dialectal pronunciations
culturalContext.musicalContext: Formal greeting phrase to open the Tet song

facts: Tet visitors traditionally announce their origin
This establishes the guest-host relationship
culturalContext.musicalContext: Singer identifies themselves as a visiting well-wisher

phrases.text: Ngó bao tính khướng rướng tâm nhá ôông
phrases.english: I see your expansive fields and orchards, sir

facts: Tet songs traditionally compliment the host's wealth and fortune
Agricultural abundance is a common Tet blessing theme
culturalContext.musicalContext: Observational praise of the household's prosperity

phrases.text: Pên clước nhá ôông có dặn cặt câu
phrases.english: Behind your house, you have jackfruit trees

facts: Jackfruit trees are valuable assets in Vietnamese households
Fruit trees symbolize long-term prosperity
culturalContext.musicalContext: Detailed inventory of the host's bounty

phrases.text: Pên khau nhà ôông có đặng cặt mít ôông ơi
phrases.english: In front of your house, you also have jackfruit trees, oh sir

facts: Repetition emphasizes the completeness of prosperity
Both front and back of house having fruit trees indicates thorough wealth

phrases.text: Kìa chót chim chích ăn leo
phrases.english: Look, the small birds are eating and climbing

facts: Birds in the garden are considered good omens during Tet
Active wildlife indicates a healthy, prosperous environment
culturalContext.musicalContext: Shifts to lively imagery of birds

phrases.text: chót chim khéo ăn lèo ăn lệ
phrases.english: the skillful birds eat here and there

facts: Repetitive eating imagery suggests abundance of fruit
Skillful birds represent cleverness and vitality

phrases.text: Lê muêch cành con con cho ôông ti pán
phrases.english: Pear branches with children for you to count

facts: 'Con con' (children children) wishes for many descendants
Fruit metaphors often represent fertility and family

phrases.text: Bán ăn ciu ý lê bằng ciu
phrases.english: Sell and eat, oh yes, pears equally

facts: Having enough to both sell and eat indicates abundance
Equal distribution represents fairness and harmony

phrases.text: Pán ăn bỏ lê bằng bỏ
phrases.english: Count, eat, and throw away pears equally

facts: So much fruit that some can be discarded shows great wealth
Hyperbolic imagery common in Tet blessing songs

phrases.text: Tách báo cò con khăng lố lố
phrases.english: The stork announces, carrying the baby, flying high

facts: Storks carrying babies is a traditional Asian fertility symbol
Wishing for children is central to Tet blessings
culturalContext.musicalContext: Introduces stork imagery for fertility blessing

phrases.text: Tách bào cò con khăng lố lế
phrases.english: The stork carries the baby, flying gracefully

facts: Repetition intensifies the blessing
Slight variation maintains musical interest

phrases.text: Ló nếp nhá ôông dở vêt múa kháng năm
phrases.english: Your sticky rice, sir, is ready for the five-year dance

facts: Sticky rice is essential for Tet celebrations
Five-year cycles are significant in traditional calendars
culturalContext.musicalContext: Links rice abundance to festive celebration

phrases.text: Lò chăm nhá ôông dở vết múa kháng chín múa mười
phrases.english: Your rice crops, sir, are ready for nine and ten celebrations

facts: Nine and ten represent completion and perfection in Vietnamese culture
Enough for many celebrations indicates great prosperity

phrases.text: kẻ chợ đang mai phát nác
phrases.english: people in the market tomorrow, greetings burst forth

facts: Markets are vibrant during Tet with people exchanging greetings
Tomorrow references the continuing celebration
culturalContext.musicalContext: Closing phrase projects blessings into future celebrations

statistics.dominantPattern: Tet greeting song with agricultural blessings and fertility wishes
